DOC.HEAD: Robber Takes Cab to Bank for $10,000 Heist
DOC.TEXT: A fare told cabbie Carl Olson Jr. to wait for him when he was dropped off at the First American Bank, saying he was just going to rob it and be right out. ``Meet me a little later ... I'm going to rob a bank,'' the thief told Olson, according to police. A man took $10,000 from the bank at about 12:50 p.m. Friday. Police, alerted by Olson, arrived moments later, according to Detective Capt. Vincent Foley. Though the robber had already disappeared, the robbery was recorded by bank security cameras. Albany detectives and FBI agents said Friday they were searching for Arthur J. DeLorenzo, 29, of Schenectady, for questioning in the robbery. The robber didn't have a weapon, police said.
